segment.source: Install Windows from a USB Flash Drive
segment.target: Install Windows from a USB Flash Drive

segment.source: Install Windows from a USB Flash Drive
segment.target: Install Windows from a USB Flash Drive

segment.source: Install Windows from a USB Flash Drive
segment.target: Install Windows from a USB Flash Drive

segment.source: To install Windows to a device without a DVD drive, you can use a USB flash drive.
segment.target: To install Windows to a device without a DVD drive, you can use a USB flash drive.

segment.source: Format the drive and set the primary partition as active
segment.target: Format the drive and set the primary partition as active

segment.source: Connect a USB flash drive to your PC.
segment.target: Connect a USB flash drive to your PC.

segment.source: Open Disk Management: Start Settings: Create and format hard disk partitions.
segment.target: Open Disk Management: Start Settings: Create and format hard disk partitions.

segment.source: Format the partition: Right-click the USB drive partition Format.
segment.target: Format the partition: Right-click the USB drive partition Format.

segment.source: Select the FAT32 file system to be able to boot either BIOS-based or UEFI-based PCs.
segment.target: Select the FAT32 file system to be able to boot either BIOS-based or UEFI-based PCs.

segment.source: Set the partition as active: Right-click the USB drive partition Mark Partition as Active.
segment.target: Set the partition as active: Right-click the USB drive partition Mark Partition as Active.

segment.source: Copy Windows Setup to the USB flash drive
segment.target: Copy Windows Setup to the USB flash drive

segment.source: Copy and paste the entire contents of the Windows product DVD to the USB flash drive.
segment.target: Copy and paste the entire contents of the Windows product DVD to the USB flash drive.

segment.source: Optional: add an Unattend file or a configuration set to automate the installation process.
segment.target: Optional: add an Unattend file or a configuration set to automate the installation process.

segment.source: For more information, see Automate Windows Setup.
segment.target: For more information, see Automate Windows Setup.

segment.source: Install Windows to the new PC
segment.target: Install Windows to the new PC

segment.source: Connect the USB flash drive to a new PC.
segment.target: Connect the USB flash drive to a new PC.

segment.source: Turn on the PC and press the key that opens the boot-device selection menu for the computer, such as the Esc key.
segment.target: Turn on the PC and press the key that opens the boot-device selection menu for the computer, such as the Esc key.

segment.source: Select the option that boots the PC from the USB flash drive.
segment.target: Select the option that boots the PC from the USB flash drive.

segment.source: Windows Setup starts.
segment.target: Windows Setup starts.

segment.source: Follow the instructions to install Windows.
segment.target: Follow the instructions to install Windows.

segment.source: Remove the USB flash drive.
segment.target: Remove the USB flash drive.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.source: Windows Setup Technical Reference
segment.target: Windows Setup Technical Reference
